rComments: Pretty easy class, first time she's taught it so a bit shaky. She's a very kind teacher and very clear with her expectations of you, perhaps a bit dull at times but it's really no problem. I had a lot of fun in the class and I'm sure she'll improve it over time. Would recommend.

She really pushes you to put two and two together to learn Russian. Can come off kind of harsh and super sassy in class, but she's always willing to help and really just wants everyone to actually study outside of class. Participation is mandatory, must answer questions verbally every day in class

PRO: engages each student; answers all of your questions; good looking CON: spends too much time on going over HW, rather than  teaching new and going over old stuff; mostly depends on the book and workbook, which imo aren't effectively organized  You'll get a good grade and learn the basics if you do the HWs and participate in class.

I've taken Natalya for Russian all the way up to Russian 4 and have really appreciated her. She comes off as very serious, but she is always willing to help. For the most part is very patient. Class was kind of difficult, and the midterms and final were killer, but I think she grades based mostly off of participation.
